item.title: Writing Better Alert Names - How to win hearts of SOC Analysts
item.description: “What you see and what you hear depends a great deal on where you are standing. It also depends on what sort of person you are.” ~ The Magicians Nephew - CS Lewis Thanks to Hanner for her feedback on this post. The Problem Detection Engineering requires you to be a storyteller Detection engineering is inherently a very technical and often abstracted process, but conversely, there’s a very intricately human part of creating a detection.

item.title: Writing Alert Names that Don't Suck - How to win hearts of SOC Analysts
item.description: “What you see and what you hear depends a great deal on where you are standing. It also depends on what sort of person you are.” ~ The Magicians Nephew - CS Lewis Set the scene Detection Engineering is not just about the technical nitty gritty, it almost requres you to be a storyteller Detection engineering is inherently a very technical and often abstracted process, but conversely there’s a very intricately human part of creating a detection.

item.title: Supporting Analysts Better - SecTalks CBR Sep 2023
item.description: Thanks for coming along, here’s a collection of resources, some of the graphics, and references from the night. Appreciate all the feedback. SOC https://posts.specterops.io/introducing-the-funnel-of-fidelity-b1bb59b04036 https://web.archive.org/web/20220325143601/https://criticaluncertainties.com/2013/07/05/better-wrong-than-vague/ Sensitivity and Specificity Great video that gets you up to speed quickly https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=psELBu7muNY These ones are super in depth, rewarding if you can stay awake https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fpubh.2017.00307/full https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2636062/ Triage https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edwin_Smith_Papyrus https://acem.org.au/Content-Sources/Advancing-Emergency-Medicine/Better-Outcomes-for-Patients/Triage Investigation https://www.healthknowledge.org.uk/public-health-textbook/disease-causation-diagnostic/2c-diagnosis-screening/screening-diagnostic-case-finding https://www.mindtools.com/au7v71d/the-johari-window A.S.S - Analyst Support System Quality Reads :tm: https://www.freshwaterpublishing.com.au/book/ https://atulgawande.com/book/the-checklist-manifesto/

item.title: CyberCon 2023 Incident Management References
item.description: References Thanks for listening :) Australian Fire Authorities Council for AIIMS related material https://www.afac.com.au/initiative/aiims https://www.afac.com.au/insight/doctrine Coronial inquests and Reviews https://nla.gov.au/nla.obj-3112961467/view http://royalcommission.vic.gov.au/finaldocuments/summary/PF/VBRC_Summary_PF.pdf https://viewer.slv.vic.gov.au/?entity=IE20138510&mode=browse https://www.nsw.gov.au/nsw-government/projects-and-initiatives/floodinquiry Australian Journal of Emergency Management https://knowledge.aidr.org.au/collections/australian-journal-of-emergency-management/ Australian Institute for Disaster Resilience (Australian Emergency Management Library and handbook collection https://knowledge.aidr.org.au/collections/emergency-management-library/ https://knowledge.aidr.org.au/collections/handbook-collection/ The ACSC CSIRP Template https://www.cyber.gov.au/acsc/view-all-content/publications/cyber-incident-response-plan https://www.cyber.gov.au/sites/default/files/2022-07/ACSC%20Cyber%20Incident%20Response%20Plan%20Guidance_A4.pdf

item.title: How to win support of the Analysts near you - Writing Alert Names that Don't Suck
item.description: “What you see and what you hear depends a great deal on where you are standing. It also depends on what sort of person you are.” The Magicians Nephew Set the scene Detection Engineering is equal parts storytelling and equal parts technical. Detection engineering is inherently a very technical and often abstracted process, but conversely there’s a very intricately human part of this process. The ultimate goal goal of detection engineering is to select an event that requires further investigation out of a vast ocean of events and land that in front of an analyst and (hopefully do that in the most efficient way possible)

item.title: Powershell Working With AD and Variables
item.description: This is going to be the first in a series of posts chronicling my journey with PowerShell: See here for the details, I shan’t bore you again. Setting the scene… I recently found myself in a position with a client where they passed on a request that was: “Our CISO has requested that we go out and find all privileged service accounts” For this particular client service accounts are identified with “SRV_ACC” at the start of the username.

item.title: About
item.description: whois archbishop... I like solving problems, and learning new things, I suppose this is where you put that you’re a perpetual student and all that jazz. Just another dude who likes breaking stuff, just really slowly because I’m a bit dumb. During the day I work in a Security Operations Center as an Lead Analyst What I also like is people, so feel free to reach out. I’m also on OJ’s discord as “TheArchbishop”.

item.title: How to PowerShell More Betterer
item.description: Why? There are thousands of blogs, posts and resources out there already about PowerShell, did we really some other numpty sharing their thoughts? This is the question I asked myself when the thought first flashed across my mind, “I could make a blog”. Making a blog is pretty easy these days, but apparently an important part of having a blog is actually having content on it, and given that I don’t have anything new to share or any cool tools to release.

item.title: Hello
item.description: Finally time to revive this, I have decided to start writing more. Archbishop
